column4: well since no one answered in kubuntu. what are your views with making the home partition ntfs to share with vista?
I'd prefer to keep linux linux.. if you need to share data between OSes... make a share partition that is NTFS.

Also there is a possibility that NTFS won't play nice (ie. there is some suggestions that it doesn't play nice when writing to NTFS) I'd hate to hose my home dir that contains every config for all the software I run
I've never had a problem with it, but like I said, I have a /share partition that is NTFS just in case Murphey makes an appearance.
